body.p:
To His Excellency B Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned would respectfully represent that at the March Term 1861, of the Shelby circuit court, he was under Indictment fined $300 -- for keeping a disorderly house He would respectfully represent that the fine is oppressive in the extreme He admits that he did get a little two much licker aboard & that whilst in that condition some of his neighbors came to his house and according to old fashioned hospitality he offered them something to drink, as he had a right to do -- he drank with them and he became very noisy -- he is now an old man, raised up under the old hospitable habits of Kentucky and has never joined the new fangled temporance society he was ^on^ his own premisses and never intended to disturb his neighbors -- it being in the country -- the costs & attorneys fee will be a pretty dear price for a frolic he therefore prays your Excelency to remit said judgment, & as in duty bound he will ever pray &c
We the undersigned unite with the Petitioner in asking a remission of said Judgment
